text: In mid-1974, ten or twelve bombs exploded in Buenos Aires at night. Different sign, but they explode. Wake up at two or three in the morning with several egrets in a line, it was almost a habit. Even the children were accustomed to that routine. A Parisian friend began to realize this adaptation when a strong explosion woke his five-year-old son, who was sleeping in his bed. “What was that?” he asked. My friend took him in his arms, comforted him, but, according to his educational principles, told him the truth: “It was a bomb.” “What luck!” the boy said. “I thought he was a liar.” FIN
title: Rutinas
author: Mario Benedetti
